name: Linear Capabilities
description: Evaluation dataset for Linear subagent capabilities including issue management, project tracking, labels, and team operations. Includes lazy queries, intentional mistakes, and ambiguous items.

items.input: create issue for fixing login bug
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Create issue with title about login bug fix.
items.context: User wants to create a simple issue

items.input: show my assigned issues
items.expected_output: 1. Get current user ID. 2. List issues filtered by assignee_id.
items.context: User wants to see their issues

items.input: create issue 'Implement dark mode' on Mobile team with high priority
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Find Mobile team. 3. Create issue with title, team_id, and priority=1.
items.context: User wants detailed issue creation

items.input: assign issue about payment to john
items.expected_output: 1. Search/list issues about payment. 2. Get users. 3. Find john. 4. Update issue with assignee.
items.context: User wants to assign issue

items.input: move issue FE-123 to in progress
items.expected_output: 1. Get issue FE-123. 2. Get team states. 3. Find 'In Progress' state. 4. Update issue state.
items.context: User wants to change issue state

items.input: add comment to issue about the API changes being deployed
items.expected_output: 1. Search issues about API. 2. Create comment on the issue.
items.context: User wants to comment on issue

items.input: list all projects
items.expected_output: List all Linear projects.
items.context: User wants to see projects

items.input: create project called 'Q1 Roadmap' for team Backend
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Find Backend team. 3. Create project with name and team association.
items.context: User wants to create project

items.input: get all teams
items.expected_output: List all Linear teams in workspace.
items.context: User wants to see teams

items.input: add label 'urgent' to issue about checkout
items.expected_output: 1. Search issues about checkout. 2. Get/create urgent label. 3. Update issue with label.
items.context: User wants to add label to issue

items.input: create label 'tech-debt' with red color on team Engineering
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Find Engineering team. 3. Create label with name and color.
items.context: User wants to create new label

items.input: get details of issue FE-99
items.expected_output: Get Linear issue by identifier FE-99 with full details.
items.context: User wants specific issue details

items.input: what cycles are active for team Frontend
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Find Frontend team. 3. Get cycles by team ID.
items.context: User wants to see sprints/cycles

items.input: remove label from issue about refactoring
items.expected_output: 1. Search issues about refactoring. 2. Get issue labels. 3. Remove specified label.
items.context: User wants to remove label

items.input: list all labels
items.expected_output: Get all labels across workspace.
items.context: User wants to see available labels

items.input: archive the old issue about deprecated feature
items.expected_output: 1. Search issues about deprecated feature. 2. Confirm deletion/archive. 3. Delete/archive issue.
items.context: User wants to archive issue - needs consent

items.input: who are the users in my workspace
items.expected_output: List all Linear users in workspace.
items.context: User wants to see team members

items.input: set due date for issue about onboarding to next friday
items.expected_output: 1. Search issues about onboarding. 2. Update issue with due date.
items.context: User wants to set deadline

items.input: get issue in lineer about authentication
items.expected_output: 1. Recognize 'lineer' as typo for 'linear'. 2. Search issues about authentication.
items.context: User made typo in 'linear'

items.input: add attachment link to issue FE-50
items.expected_output: 1. Get issue FE-50. 2. Create attachment with URL on issue.
items.context: User wants to add link attachment

items.input: who am I logged in as
items.expected_output: Get current authenticated user information.
items.context: User wants to see their identity

items.input: what are the workflow states for team Mobile
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Find Mobile team. 3. List states for that team.
items.context: User wants to see workflow states

items.input: create issue in current sprint about performance optimization
items.expected_output: 1. Get teams. 2. Get current/active cycle. 3. Create issue with cycle_id.
items.context: User wants issue in current cycle

items.input: show all issues in project Alpha
items.expected_output: 1. Get projects. 2. Find 'Alpha' project. 3. List issues filtered by project_id.
items.context: User wants project-specific issues

items.input: link issue FE-40 to issue FE-45
items.expected_output: Create issue relation/link between FE-40 and FE-45.
items.context: User wants to link related issues

items.input: add üëç reaction to the comment saying 'looks good'
items.expected_output: 1. Find comment with text 'looks good'. 2. Add thumbsup reaction to comment.
items.context: User wants to react to comment

items.input: change priority of bug issue to critical
items.expected_output: 1. Search issues with 'bug' in title/description. 2. Update issue priority to critical (0 or 1).
items.context: User wants to escalate priority

items.input: list issues completed this week
items.expected_output: List issues filtered by completed state and date range.
items.context: User wants completed issues report
